Note:
Game State [8-bit]
0x00 = Not In Game
0x80 = In Game

Player Score (7 Bytes)
Each byte in this array represents one place within the top score, starting in the million's place (0x002c) and ending in the one's place (0x0032). Max for each byte is 9.

Top Score (7 Bytes)
Each byte in this array represents one place within the top score, starting in the million's place (0x003a) and ending in the one's place (0x0040). Max for each byte is 9.

Hostage Array [24 bytes]
Each byte is divided into two parts (upper and lower) that can represent up to two collected hostages.
0x00 = Not Collected
Lower4 > 0 = Collected
Upper4 > 0 = Collected

Hostages [8-bit]
Each round starts at 0x0a (10) and reduces by one each time a hostage is collected.
When count flips from 0x01 to 0x00 the exit will open.

Question Mark Collected [8-bit]
Increases each time a ? is collected and rewards points.
If ? rewards invincibility, this does not increase (check 0x0915 for a value of 0x20)

Invincibility Counter [8-bit]
When greater than 0 counts down to 0. While this value is greater than 0 the player is invulnerable.

Respawn Timer [8-bit]
Sets to 0x27 when the player dies and counts down to 0x00

Item Collected [8-bit]
Only includes W, S, and ?
Invincibility only triggers when timer is at 272, 262, 232, 222, 171, 161, 131, 121, 70, 60, 30, and 20
0x01 = ?
0x02 = S
0x04 = W
0x20 = ? (Invincibility)

Items Collected [8-bit]
Tracks the number of items collected during a round. Increase by 1 each time an item is collected.
